callForPapers:
# CATA 2025: Call for Papers

The 40th International Conference on Computers and Their Applications (CATA 2025) will be held at the **Crowne Plaza Hotel, San Francisco Airport, CA, US, on March 17-18, 2025.**

## Conference Overview

The conference provides an international forum for the presentation and discussion of research on computers and their applications. CATA 2025 will feature contributed, as well as invited papers concerned with theory, practice, and applications. The conference also includes the best paper award, given for a paper presented at the conference.

## Topics

The topics will include, but are not limited to, the following areas:

*   Artificial Intelligence
*   Computer and Network Security
*   Computer Graphics
*   Computer Modeling
*   Computer Networks
*   Computer Vision
*   Computers and Education
*   Control Systems
*   Data Communications
*   Databases
*   Data Mining/Knowledge Discovery
*   Digital Signal Processing
*   Expert Systems
*   Human-Computer Interface
*   Human-Computer Visualization
*   Image Processing
*   Information Systems
*   Multimedia Applications
*   Neural Networks
*   Pattern Recognition
*   Programming Languages
*   Real-Time Computing
*   Robotics

## Keynote Speaker

*   Bilal Clarance, Director of Engineering Graph Serving Team at Google: "Knowledge for Search and AI"

## Submission Guidelines

Papers will be accepted only by electronic submission (PDF only). A full paper, including title, author's name(s) and affiliation, mailing address, telephone, fax, and email of the principal author, should be submitted before **November 16, 2024** online.

The submitted manuscript should closely reflect the final paper as it will appear in the proceedings published in Springer Nature. Accepted papers will be published by Springer Nature and submitted for indexing to major online indexes, such as Google Scholar and Scopus.

## Publication

Accepted papers in CATA-2025 will be published (full text online) in Springer and will be indexed in Scopus, Google Scholar, EI, and INSPEC, and submitted to DBLP for indexing.

## Important Dates

*   **Full paper submission:** November 16, 2024
*   **Notification of acceptance:** January 4, 2025
*   **Word files, PDFs of final Camera-ready paper and License to publish due:** January 18, 2025
*   **Conference registration materials due:** February 7, 2025
*   **CATA 2025 in San Francisco, CA, USA:** March 17-18, 2025

## Templates

[https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines)

callForPapers:
# CASE 2025: Call for Papers

The 2025 IEEE 21st International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering (CASE 2025) will be held in **Los Angeles, California, USA from August 17 – August 21, 2025**. The pre-conference workshops will be held on August 17, 2025.

## Theme

**Secured and Trustworthy Automation:** Automation systems increasingly rely on secured and trustworthy automation. Research is needed to overcome vulnerability and bias due to imperfect system design, data collection, machine learning, or control.

## Topics

The conference will cover a wide range of topics on Systems, Automation, Autonomous Systems, Discrete Event Systems, Smart Cities, Robotics, Building Automation, Automation in Meso, Micro and Nano-scale, Big Data, Machine Learning, Information and Communication Technologies, etc.

Topics include, but are not limited to:

*   Foundation of Automation
*   Human-centered automation
*   Automation in life science and healthcare
*   Sustainability and green automation
*   Automation in agriculture and horticulture
*   Automation in meso, micro and nano-scale
*   Smart building and construction
*   Knowledge-based automation
*   Manufacturing automation
*   Cloud-based automation
*   Big data, data mining and machine learning
*   Privacy and security in automation

## Submission Categories

Authors are invited to submit their research contributions, which may include:

*   Regular Papers
*   Special Session Papers
*   Special Session Abstracts
*   Industry Papers
*   Presentation-only Papers

### Regular Papers

*   The number of pages (including text, figures, tables, acknowledgement, and references) is limited to six, but two additional pages will be permitted at an extra page charge.
*   Regular papers exceeding 8 pages will be returned without review.
*   All papers must be submitted in PDF and must follow the standard IEEE conference double-column format.
*   All accepted regular papers will be included in the conference program and published in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Submission deadline:** March 15, 2025

### Special Session Papers

*   Special session papers are distinct from regular papers because they are tailored to the specific topic of a special session.
*   They undergo the same review and selection process as regular papers but are grouped together within the special session to create a cohesive program.
*   The number of pages (including text, figures, tables, acknowledgement and references) is limited to six, but two additional pages will be permitted at an extra page charge.
*   Special session papers exceeding 8 pages will be returned without review.
*   All papers must be submitted in PDF and must follow the standard IEEE conference double-column format.
*   Special session papers will be included in the conference program and published in IEEE Xplore.
*   **Submission deadline:** March 15, 2025

### Special Session Abstracts

*   The number of pages (including text, figures, tables, acknowledgement and references) is limited to two.
*   Abstracts exceeding 2 pages will be returned without review.
*   All papers must be submitted in PDF and must follow the standard IEEE conference double-column format.
*   Accepted abstracts will make oral presentations at the conference, but they will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore and thus will NOT be indexed on platforms like Scopus.
*   **Submission deadline:** April 1, 2025

### Work-in-progress and Industry Presentation-only Papers

*   The number of pages (including text, figures, tables, acknowledgement and references) is limited to four.
*   Work-in-progress and industry presentation-only papers exceeding 4 pages will be returned without review.
*   Presentation-only Papers will make oral presentations at the conference, but they will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore and thus will NOT be indexed on platforms like Scopus.
*   **Submission deadline:** April 15, 2025

### Work-in-progress and Industry Presentation-only Papers for Special Sessions

*   The number of pages (including text, figures, tables, acknowledgement and references) is limited to four.
*   Work-in-progress and industry presentation-only papers exceeding 4 pages will be returned without review.
*   Presentation-only Papers will make oral presentations at the conference, but they will NOT appear in IEEE Xplore and thus will NOT be indexed on platforms like Scopus.
*   **Submission deadline:** April 15, 2025

### T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L and RAM Presentations

If you have published (authored or co-authored) a paper in one of the IEEE Robotics & Automation Society journals, you have the possibility to present your work at CASE 2025.

*   Only the original paper abstract is required. You should also include the full journal paper and the citation details, plus DOI.
*   To be eligible for presentation at CASE 2025, your paper must be transferred between December 1, 2024, and May 2, 2025.
*   The paper must be transferred within 270 days of acceptance. Authors may not request any acceleration or delay of the review process based on these time windows.
*   **Submission deadline:** April 30, 2025

## Important Dates

*   **Special session proposal submission:** February 15, 2025
*   **Regular and special session full paper submission:** March 15, 2025 (final)
*   **Workshop/tutorial proposal submission, Industry paper and work-in-progress paper submission:** April 15, 2025
*   **T-ASE, T-RO, RA-L and RAM presentation submission:** April 30, 2025
*   **Paper acceptance notification:** May 30, 2025
*   **Early bird registration:** June 13, 2025
*   **Final paper submission and author registration:** June 27, 2025
*   **Final program:** July 17, 2025
*   **Pre-conference workshops:** August 17, 2025
*   **Conference officially starts:** August 18, 2025

## Venue

Millennium Biltmore Downtown Los Angeles, California, USA
